陸.definition: (bound form) land (as opposed to the sea)

陸克文.definition: Chinese name adopted by Kevin Rudd (1957-), Australian politician proficient in Mandarin, prime minister 2007-2010 and 2013

陸地.definition: dry land (as opposed to the sea)

陸委會.definition: Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会

陸川.definition: Luchuan county in Yulin 玉林[Yu4 lin2], Guangxi

陸川縣.definition: Luchuan county in Yulin 玉林[Yu4 lin2], Guangxi

陸徵祥.definition: Lu Zhengxiang (1871-1949), Chinese diplomat and Catholic monk

陸戰.definition: (military) to fight on land; ground warfare

陸探微.definition: Lu Tanwei (active c. 450-490), one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家

陸榮廷.definition: Lu Rongting (1858-1928), provincial governor of Guangxi under the Qing, subsequently leader of old Guangxi warlord faction

陸機.definition: Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic

陸河.definition: Luhe county in Shanwei 汕尾, Guangdong

陸河縣.definition: Luhe county in Shanwei 汕尾, Guangdong

陸港矛盾.definition: tensions between mainland China and Hong Kong (since 1997)

陸游.definition: Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets

陸續.definition: in turn; successively; one after the other; bit by bit

陸羽.definition: Lu Yu (733-804), Chinese writer from Tang dynasty, known for his obsession with tea

陸良.definition: Luliang county in Qujing 曲靖[Qu3 jing4], Yunnan

陸良縣.definition: Luliang county in Qujing 曲靖[Qu3 jing4], Yunnan

陸西星.definition: Lu Xixing (1520-c. 1601), Ming Daoist author, to whom the fantasy novel Investiture of the Gods 封神演義|封神演义[Feng1 shen2 Yan3 yi4] is attributed, together with Xu Zhonglin 許仲琳|许仲琳[Xu3 Zhong4 lin2]

陸豐.definition: see 陸豐市|陆丰市[Lu4feng1 Shi4]

陸豐市.definition: Lufeng, county-level city in Shanwei 汕尾市[Shan4wei3 Shi4], Guangdong

陸陸續續.definition: in succession; one after another; continuously
